perturbation.original_text: Section 4.2. Termination for Convenience. Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice for any reason, including if the usage of the Brand is not in compliance with the standards and policies.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.2. Termination for Convenience. Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice for any reason.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'including if the usage of the Brand is not in compliance with the standards and policies,' Section 4.2 no longer explicitly connects the Brand's usage to the termination clause. However, other sections (e.g., Section 3.1 on Quality Control) still emphasize the importance of maintaining the Brand's quality, potentially creating a contradiction. It becomes unclear whether a minor deviation from quality standards, not explicitly severe enough for 'any reason,' could trigger termination, thus creating uncertainty in enforcement. There is an inconsistency with 3.1 with states the usage needs to be consistent with Licensor's high standards, yet the Licensor can terminate at any time.

perturbation.original_text: Section 3.2. Prior Written Approval. Prior to using the Brand in any manner, Licensee shall submit all proposed uses to Licensor for prior written approval.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 3.2. Prior Approval. Prior to using the Brand in any new advertising campaign, Licensee shall submit all proposed uses to Licensor for approval.
perturbation.explanation: By limiting the 'Prior Written Approval' clause to 'new advertising campaign', the contract creates ambiguity. Section 3.1 states that the Licensee's Permitted Activity shall be consistent with Licensor's high standards of and reputation for quality. By narrowing the scope of 3.2, there is ambiguity if Licensee needs to have prior approval for all other uses of the Brand other than new advertising campaigns.

perturbation.original_text: Section 4.4. Termination of Advisory Agreement. This Agreement shall terminate automatically without notice and immediately (a) if MS Capital Partners Adviser Inc. or another affiliate of Licensor is no longer acting as the investment adviser (any such entity, the "Advisor") to Licensee under the Investment Advisory Agreement, dated as of [Â·], 201[9] (as the same may 2 Source: MORGAN STANLEY DIRECT LENDING FUND, 10-12G/A, 11/19/2019 be amended, modified or otherwise restated, the "Investment Advisory Agreement"), or a similar agreement, or (b) the Advisor is no longer an affiliate of Licensor.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 4.4. Termination of Advisory Agreement. This Agreement shall terminate automatically without notice and immediately (a) if the Advisor is no longer acting as the investment adviser to Licensee or (b) the Advisor is no longer an affiliate of Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit definition of 'Advisor' as 'MS Capital Partners Adviser Inc. or another affiliate of Licensor' and removing the Investment Advisory Agreement reference, Section 4.4 becomes ambiguous. While it still links termination to the advisory relationship, it's unclear which 'Advisor' and which 'agreement' is being referenced. Other sections, such as the preamble that references investment advisory services provided by Licensor, still imply a specific advisory relationship. The omission of who the Advisor is causes an internal contradiction.
